results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Cold War Era;Espionage and Intelligence Services;Hanssen, Robert Phillip
results.title: Robert Hanssen, F.B.I. Agent Exposed as Spy for Moscow, Dies at 79
results.abstract: Mr. Hanssen was sentenced to life in prison in 2002, bringing to a close one of the most lurid and damaging espionage cases in American history.

media.caption: Robert Hanssen was arrested in a Virginia park in February 2001 after he left classified documents for his Russian handlers. He was sentenced to life in prison.

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Special Prosecutors (Independent Counsel);United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Smith, Jack (Attorney);Garland, Merrick B;Justice Department
results.byline: By Alan Feuer, Maggie Haberman, Glenn Thrush and Jonathan Swan
results.title: Trump Lawyers Visit Justice Dept. as Classified Documents Inquiry Nears End
results.abstract: Three lawyers representing the former president spent nearly two hours there after requesting a meeting to discuss their concerns about the department’s handling of the investigation.

media.caption: By sending a letter to Attorney General Merrick B. Garland, former President Donald J. Trump was relying on a frequently used playbook, in which he suggests a judge or prosecutor is treating him unfairly by the act of investigating him.
media.copyright: Sophie Park for The New York Times

results.title: What Happened When a Brooklyn Neighborhood Policed Itself for Five Days
results.abstract: On a two-block stretch of Brownsville in April, the police stepped aside and let residents respond to 911 calls. It was a bold experiment that some believe could redefine law enforcement in New York City.
